decription: A record in the books, proceedings, standards, theses and reports.

_collections.description:
:MARC: ``980__a`` ``690C_a`` ``697C_a``
Collections to which this record belongs
.. note:: Different values compared to Inspire. Not mandatory, used for some specific subsets of the collection.
_collections.title: Collections

_private_notes.description:
:MARC: ``595``
These notes are only visible to privileged users, not regular
users.

items.description:
This is used to add, besides the `value`, the `source` where this value
came from.

source.description:
Source of the information in this field. As several records can be merged,
this information allows us to remember where every bit of metadata came
from and make decisions based on it.
:MARC: Often not present.
.. Notes::

_private_notes.title: List of private notes

abstracts.description:
:MARC: ``520``
The first abstract is the preferred one, to be displayed in
priority.

items.description:
This is used to add, besides the `value`, the `source` where this value
came from.

source.description:
Source of the information in this field. As several records can be merged,
this information allows us to remember where every bit of metadata came
from and make decisions based on it.
:MARC: Often not present.
.. Notes::

abstracts.title: List of abstracts

acquisition_source.description:
:MARC: ``595``,``859``,``916``
Only the first source is stored: if the record later gets enriched with
metadata coming from a second source, the `acquisition_source` is not
updated.

datetime.description:
:MARC: `916__w``,`595__a (with certain conditions)``
This does not necessarily coincide with the creation date of the
record, as there might be some delay between the moment the
original information is obtained and a record is finally created in
the system.
datetime.title: Date on which the metadata was obtained

email.description:
:MARC: ``859``
This only gets populated when `method` is `submitter`.
email.title: Email address associated to the submitter's account

internal_uid.description: This only gets populated when `method` is `submitter`.
internal_uid.title: Inspire user ID of the submitter

method.description:
Possible values are:
`submitter`
    when obtained from a user submission. In this case, `orcid`,
    `internal_uid` and `email` store identifiers of the submitter,
    and `submission_number` an ID of the submission. The submitter can be the cataloger.
`oai`
    when obtained by OAI-PMH harvesting.
`batchuploader`
    when obtained through the batch uploader.
`hepcrawl`
    when obtained from a hepcrawl crawler. In this case, `source`
    stores the publisher or the repository that was crawled.
method.title: Data obtaining method

orcid.description: This only gets populated when `method` is `submitter`.
orcid.title: ORCID of the submitter

source.description:
Source of the information in this field. As several records can be merged,
this information allows us to remember where every bit of metadata came
from and make decisions based on it.
:MARC: Often not present.
.. Notes::

submission_number.description: This only gets populated when `method` is `submitter`.
submission_number.title: Holding pen record ID of the submission

acquisition_source.title: Origin of the metadata in the record

authors.description:
:MARC: ``100``, ``700``
Besides authors, also contains editors and supervisors (see
:ref:`hep.json#/properties/authors/items/properties/inspire_roles`).

items.description:
:MARC: not present.
Role of the author according to the `Contributor
Roles Taxonomy (CRediT)
<http://dictionary.casrai.org/Contributor_Roles>`_
items.title: Credit role of author

curated_relation.description: This field is true when the author ID was processed by \#BEARD\# script

full_name.description:
:MARC: ``100/700/__a``
Author name in Latin alphabet (may contain diacritics).
Should be of the form 'family names, first names', and,
except for a possible reordering, be exactly as on the
paper.
:example: ``Smith Davis, John F.K.``
full_name.title: Author name

anyOf.description:
This identifier is assigned to any curated author record (HEPNAMES on
legacy).  It is mainly used by large collaborations (providing an
`authors.xml` file) to uniquely identify the authors of their articles.
anyOf.title: Inspire ID

anyOf.description:
The BAI (BibAuthorID) is based on the name of the author and is used as
a human-friendly unique identifier. Its general form is a
``firstnames.lastnames.number``, where ``firstnames`` is a list of
first names (or initials) separated by dots, and similarly for
``lastnames``. Only ASCII letters (without diacritics), numbers, dashes
and apostrophes are allowed in the names. By default, only initials of
first names are used, but this may be changed at a cataloguer's
discretion in order to disambiguate otherwise homonymous authors.
.. note::
    This identifier is not persistent, as it can be renamed to become
    more explicit (e.g. transforming an initial into a full name), or
    disappear when merging two different authors.
anyOf.title: Inspire BAI

anyOf.description:
`ORCID <http://orcid.org>`_ provides an identifier for individuals to
use with their name as they engage in research, scholarship, and
innovation activities.
The ORCID identifier can be resolved by prepending ``http://orcid.org``
to the `value`, in order to get the ORCID record of the person.
anyOf.title: ORCID

anyOf.description:
Author identfier assigned by the Joint Accelerator Conferences Website
(`JACoW <http://jacow.org>`_).
anyOf.title: JACoW ID

anyOf.description:
Author identifier assigned by the Japanese `KAKEN
<http://kaken.nii.ac.jp>`_ grants database.
anyOf.title: KAKEN ID

anyOf.description:
Record ID in the Virtual International Authority File (`VIAF
<http://viaf.org>`_).
anyOf.title: VIAF record ID

anyOf.description: HEPNAMES entry in the old SPIRES system.
anyOf.title: SPIRES HEPNAMES ID

value.description:
A page name on the English Wikipedia, i.e. the ``Page_name``
part in http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Page_name.
:example: ``Albert_Einstein``
Non-English Wikipedia pages can be referenced by prepending the language.
:example: ``it:Fabiola_Gianotti``

A twitter handle, often preceded by ``@``.
:example: ``Prof_S_Hawking``

Identifier of Linkedin profile, i.e. the part after
``linkedin.com/in/`` in the URL.
:example: ``kylecranmer``

anyOf.title: CDS identifier, the record ID of the author record in CDS

raw_affiliations.description:
:MARC: ``100/700__v``
List of full affiliations, as written on the paper.

items.description:
This is used to add, besides the `value`, the `source` where this value
came from.

source.description:
Source of the information in this field. As several records can be merged,
this information allows us to remember where every bit of metadata came
from and make decisions based on it.
:MARC: Often not present.
.. Notes::

items.description:
``supervisor``
    :MARC: ``700`` is used for supervisor metadata.
    This person is a thesis supervisor. Should be
    used together with the ``thesis``
    :ref:`hep.json#/properties/document_type`.
``editor``
    :MARC: ``100/700__e:ed.``
    This person is an editor of the conference
    proceedings. Should be used together with the
    ``proceedings``
    :ref:`hep.json#/properties/document_type`.

authors.title: Authors

material.description:
The possible values are:
``addendum``
    for a document extending the main publication.
``additional material``
    for additional material attached to the main publication, that is
    neither the more specific ``data`` or ``software``.
``data``
    for data related to the main publication.
``erratum``
    for a document correcting errors in the content of the main
    publication. When the errors are not in the content but in the
    publication process, it is considered as an ``editorial note`` instead.
``editorial note``
    for a document correcting errors in the metadata of the publication but
    not its content. Otherwise, it is an ``erratum``.
``preprint``
    for a document that is made public (typically on `arXiv
    <http://arxiv.org>`_) but not yet published formally.
``publication``
    for the main publication. If it's not published, it's a ``preprint``.
``reprint``
    for a reprint of the main publication.
``software``
    for software related to the main publication.
``translation``
    for a translation of the main publication.
material.title: Material to which the field refers

statement.description:
:MARC: ``542__f``
See `Wikipedia
<https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Copyright_notice>`_ for
explanations.
Alernatively to this string, a URL to the copyright
notice may be provided in :ref:`url`.
:example: ``© The Author(s) 2015. Published by Oxford
    University Press on behalf of the Physical Society
    of Japan.``
statement.title: Copyright notice

copyright.title: List of copyrights to documents in this record

document_types.description:
:MARC: ``980__a`` ``690C_a`` ``960__a``
Types of document this record represents.
.. note::
  As a record aggregates information from multiple sources, it
  can have multiple document types simultaneously. (?)

items.description:
Types of document this record represents.
.. note::
    As a record aggregates information from multiple sources, it
    can have multiple document types simultaneously. (?)
``book``
    Published Monograph (usually has an ISBN and a publisher)
``proceedings``
    Proceedings of a conference.
    The :ref:`conference_info` field contains the information of the conference.
    If published in a journal, :ref:`publication_info` also contains the journal information.
``report``
    A report. It can be unpublished, but can also be a book or a proceedings. In this case, it keeps the document type Book and Report or Proceedings and Report
``thesis``
    A thesis. The :ref:`thesis_info` field contains additional
    information about the thesis. If published as a book, the
    :ref:`editions`, :ref:`imprints`, :ref:`isbns` and
    :ref:`book_series` fields may contain specific metadata about
    this book and the document type can also be Book.
``standard``
    A standard.

document_types.title: Document types

dois.description: .. Note: This element can be found at the holding level or at the bibliographic record level.

material.description:
The possible values are:
``addendum``
    for a document extending the main publication.
``additional material``
    for additional material attached to the main publication, that is
    neither the more specific ``data`` or ``software``.
``data``
    for data related to the main publication.
``erratum``
    for a document correcting errors in the content of the main
    publication. When the errors are not in the content but in the
    publication process, it is considered as an ``editorial note`` instead.
``editorial note``
    for a document correcting errors in the metadata of the publication but
    not its content. Otherwise, it is an ``erratum``.
``preprint``
    for a document that is made public (typically on `arXiv
    <http://arxiv.org>`_) but not yet published formally.
``publication``
    for the main publication. If it's not published, it's a ``preprint``.
``reprint``
    for a reprint of the main publication.
``software``
    for software related to the main publication.
``translation``
    for a translation of the main publication.
material.title: Material to which the field refers

source.description:
Source of the information in this field. As several records can be merged,
this information allows us to remember where every bit of metadata came
from and make decisions based on it.
:MARC: Often not present.
.. Notes::

dois.title: List of DOIs

external_system_identifiers.description:
:MARC: ``035``
List of identifiers of this document on external systems.

schema.description:
:MARC: ``035__9``
Identifies the external system, and allows to interpret
unambiguously the :ref:`value`.
:example: ``ADS``

value.description:
:MARC: ``035__a``
Identifies the record in the external system specified
by :ref:`schema`.
:example: ``1999IJTP...38.1113M``
value.title: External identifier

items.description:
:MARC: ``260``
When/where/by whom this record was published.
+ reprint information (does not exist in Inspire)

reprint.description:
:MARC: ``260__g``
.. note: does not exist in Inspire
reprint.title: Date of reprint

keywords.description:
:MARC: ```6531`` and ``695`` (corresponding to different
    :ref:`keywords/items/properties/schema`)
Keywords give information about the specific contents of the
record, much more precisely than :ref:`inspire_categories`.

schema.description:
Describes to which vocabulary the keyword in :ref:`value`
belongs.
``INIS``
    :MARC: ``695__2:INIS``
    The keyword is part of the `International
    Nuclear Information System (INIS)
    <https://www.iaea.org/inis/>`_ vocabulary.
``INSPIRE``
    :MARC: ``695__2:INSPIRE``
    The keyword has been assigned by Inspire, and
    belongs to its vocabulary.
``JACOW``
    :MARC: ``6531_2:JACOW``
    The keyword is part of the `Joint Accelerator
    Conference Website (JACoW) vocabulary
    <http://jacow.org/Tools/Keywords>`_.
``PACS``
    :MARC: ``084__2:PACS``
    The keyword is a number from the `Physics and
    Astronomy Classification Scheme (PACS)
    <https://publishing.aip.org/publishing/pacs/pacs-2010-regular-edition>`_.
``PDG``
    :MARC: ``084__2:PDG``
    The keyword is a `PDG Indentifier
    <http://pdg.lbl.gov/2016/pdgid/PDGIdentifiers.html>`_.
.. note::
    If not present, the keyword is a free-form keyword,
    not necessarily part of any vocabulary.
schema.title: Keyword vocabulary

source.description:
Source of the information in this field. As several records can be merged,
this information allows us to remember where every bit of metadata came
from and make decisions based on it.
:MARC: Often not present.
.. Notes::

value.description:
:MARC: ``084/6531/695__a`` (depending on :ref:`schema`)
It belongs to the vocabulary specified by :ref:`schema`.
:example: ``black hole: mass`` (for :ref:`schema` =
    ``INSPIRE``)
:example: ``29.27.Fh`` (for :ref:`schema` = ``PACS``)
:example: ``G033M`` (for :ref:`schema` = ``PDG``)
value.title: A keyword

keywords.title: List of keywords

items.description:
Language code according to `ISO 639-1
<https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes>`_.
:example: ``el`` for Greek.
items.title: ISO 639-1 alpha 2 language code

languages.title: List of languages of the document

funder.description:
:MARC: ``540__f`` (Not Inspire)
The institution who has funded the Open Access
:example: ``CERN Library``
funder.title: Open Access funder

license.description:
:MARC: ``540__a``
Either the short name of the license or the full
license statement.
:example: ``CC-BY-4.0``
license.title: License statement

material.description:
The possible values are:
``addendum``
    for a document extending the main publication.
``additional material``
    for additional material attached to the main publication, that is
    neither the more specific ``data`` or ``software``.
``data``
    for data related to the main publication.
``erratum``
    for a document correcting errors in the content of the main
    publication. When the errors are not in the content but in the
    publication process, it is considered as an ``editorial note`` instead.
``editorial note``
    for a document correcting errors in the metadata of the publication but
    not its content. Otherwise, it is an ``erratum``.
``preprint``
    for a document that is made public (typically on `arXiv
    <http://arxiv.org>`_) but not yet published formally.
``publication``
    for the main publication. If it's not published, it's a ``preprint``.
``reprint``
    for a reprint of the main publication.
``software``
    for software related to the main publication.
``translation``
    for a translation of the main publication.
material.title: Material to which the field refers

url.description:
:MARC: ``540__u``
URL where the full license statement may be found, if
only a short name is provided in ``license``.
url.title: URL of the license

public_notes.description:
:MARC: ``500``
Any notes about the document that do not fit into another field.
For arXiv eprints, also contains the contents of the comment field
on arXiv.
.. note::
    These notes are publicly visible. For notes not shown to
    regular users, see :ref:`_private_notes`.

items.description:
This is used to add, besides the `value`, the `source` where this value
came from.

source.description:
Source of the information in this field. As several records can be merged,
this information allows us to remember where every bit of metadata came
from and make decisions based on it.
:MARC: Often not present.
.. Notes::

public_notes.title: List of public notes

record_affiliations.description:
:MARC: ``901``
Because of technical limitations, for some older records the
affiliations were associated globally to the record instead of its
individual authors (using the
:ref:`authors/items/properties/affiliations` field).
.. note::
    This field is present for legacy records and should not be used
    for new records.

value.description:
:MARC: ``901__a``
Currently, the old
:ref:`institutions.json#/properties/legacy_ICN`
is used here. In the future, this will
change and become the new
:ref:`institutions.json#/properties/ICN`.
value.title: ICN of affiliation

record_affiliations.title: Affiliations not associated to authors

related_records.description:
:MARC: ``775``
.. Note:: in the current MARC model, we use 775__b and 775__c to indicate the year, edition and language. But this could be extracted from the related record directly.

edition.description:
:MARC: 775__b
Do we need? or can it be extracted from the corresponding record?

language.description:
:MARC: 775__b
Do we need? or can it be extracted from the corresponding record?

note_freetext.description:
:MARC:
If a note is necessary to describe better the link between the records

relation.description:
:MARC: depending on ``775__b`` and ``775__c``
The possible values are:
``other edition``
``other language``
``parent``
If none of the relations apply, a free textual relation can be
provided in :ref:`relation_freetext`.
.. note::
   This should be used to link the different editions (date, language) of a same book, but also to link one volume to its parent record. In this case the display should be adapted.
relation.title: Relation of the linked record to this one

relation_freetext.description:
:MARC:
If none of the standard relations in :ref:`relation` fit, a textual
relation can alternatively be provided here.

year.description:
:MARC:  775__c
Do we need? or can it be extracted from the corresponding record?

related_records.title: Decorated link to a related record

hidden.description:
:MARC: if ``true``, the :ref:`value` is in ``037__z``,``088__9``
    instead of ``037__a````088__9``
Whether this report number should be hidden from the
display. This is appropriate for
* a report number that appears on the document but is
  not the one officially assigned;
* a report number that has been assigned by one of the
  authors institutions, but is not displayed on the
  document (typically for large collaborations).

source.description:
Source of the information in this field. As several records can be merged,
this information allows us to remember where every bit of metadata came
from and make decisions based on it.
:MARC: Often not present.
.. Notes::

report_numbers.title: List of report numbers assigned to the record

table_of_content.description:
:MARC: ``505`` whatever is the indicator
List of chapters
.. note::
    Does not exist in Inspire

title_translations.description:
:MARC: ``242``
Translations of the titles in a language that is not the language
of the document (see :ref:`languages`).
Usually, this is contains an English translation of the title of a
non-English paper, but sometimes a native language if the paper is
in English but the title has been translated.

language.description:
Language code according to `ISO 639-1
<https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes>`_.
:example: ``el`` for Greek.
language.title: ISO 639-1 alpha 2 language code

source.description:
Source of the information in this field. As several records can be merged,
this information allows us to remember where every bit of metadata came
from and make decisions based on it.
:MARC: Often not present.
.. Notes::

title.description:
:MARC: ``245``
The title should be kept as on the document and in the same language as
the document (see :ref:`languages`). Translations go into
:ref:`title_translations`.
title.title: Document title

urls.description:
:MARC: ``8564``
URLs to external resources related to this record.
.. note::
    Links to internal CDS resources are found in another element.

accelerator_experiments.description:
:MARC: 693
.. note:: Modified from Inspire: add 693__s, 693__p and not link to experiment record

accelerator.description:
:MARC: ``693__a``
If present, :ref:`institution` should contain the
institution where this accelerator is located.
.. note::
    Currently not used, see :ref:`legacy_name`.

experiment.description:
If present, :ref:`institution` should contain the
institution where this experiment is located and
:ref:`accelerator` may contain the accelerator that this
experiment is using (if appropriate).
.. note::
    Currently not used, see :ref:`legacy_name`.

institution.description:
:MARC: not present.
.. note::
    Currently not used, see :ref:`legacy_name`.
institution.title: Institution hosting the experiment

legacy_name.description:
:MARC: ``693__e``
This field is used when migrating from legacy instead
of separate :ref:`institution`, :ref:`accelerator` and
:ref:`experiment`. In the future, it will be deprecated and
the other fields will be used instead.
:example: ``CERN-LHC-CMS``
legacy_name.title: Identifier of the experiment on legacy

accelerator_experiments.title: List of related accelerators/experiments/study/project

additional_subject_categories.description: .. note: does not exist in Inspire

main.description:
:MARC: If 65017->yes
In case there are several subject terms.

additional_subject_categories.title: List of other subject (Project specific... ex. EUCARD)

items.description:
Contains metadata of an arXiv eprint contained in this record.
.. note::
    This metadata is copied over from arXiv and should not be
    edited manually.

categories.description:
:MARC: first category in ``037__c`` with ``9:arXiv``,
    all categories in ``65017a`` with ``2:arXiv``
The first category in the list has a special meaning:
it is the primary category of the eprint on arXiv.

items.description:
A category that currently exists on arXiv. Note that some categories have
been renamed and are not in this list.  These are taken from the `arXiv API
documentation
<https://arxiv.org/help/api/user-manual#subject_classifications>`_.
:example: ``math.FA`` instead of its previous name, ``funct-an``

categories.title: arXiv categories of the eprint

items.title: arXiv metadata

book_series.description:
:MARC: ``490``
List of book series in which this record has been published.
.. note::
    This field should only be present if ``book``, ``thesis`` or
    ``proceedings`` are among
    :ref:`hep.json#/properties/document_type`.

items.description:
.. note::
    If the book series has a Journal record,
    `hep.json#/properties/publication_info` should be used
    instead.

issn.description:
:MARC: ``490__x``
.. note: Does not exist in Inspire
issn.title: ISSN of the series

volume.title: Volume of the book in the series

cds_subject_categories.description: .. note: does not exist in Inspire

items.description:
:MARC: ``65017`` with ``2:CERN``
The CDS category classifies the subject
this record is related to.

main.description:
:MARC: If 65017->yes
In case there are several subject terms.

items.title: CDS category

cds_subject_categories.title: List of CDS subject

value.description:
:MARC: ``710__g``
Collaboration name as it appears on the paper (with the
``Collaboration`` suffix dropped).
:example: ``ATLAS`` instead of ``ATLAS Collaboration``
:example: ``Particle Data Group``
value.title: Collaboration name

conference_dates.description:
:MARC: ``111__d``
dates of the conference, many items do not have 111__9 and/or z

conference_title.description:
:MARC: ``111__a``
.. Note: There can be different values there.

conference_info.description:
:MARC: ``111/711``
.. Notes:: In Inspire there is a separate entity for conferences.

items.description:
:MARC: ``110__a``
In case the document has not been signed by a real author, but
only mentions the name of an organization.
:example: ``CERN``
items.title: List of corporate authors

curated.description:
:MARC: `500__a` containing `*Temporary entry*`, `*Temporary
    record*` or `*Brief entry*` correspond to `false`, otherwise it
    is `true`.
Whether this record has been curated by a human, to ensure the
quality standards of Inspire. Records having the :ref:`core` flag
are all curated eventually, whereas non-core records are
not systematically curated.

funding_info.description:
:MARC: ``536``
Information about the sources of funding for the research performed
in this record.
funding_info.title: Funding information

description.description:
:MARC: ``020__u``
:anything in ``020__u`` that does not fit in medium and is not a volume.
.. note: Does not exist in Inspire
description.title: Free text, used to describe the document to ISBN refers to.

medium.title: Physical medium to which this ISBN refers

preprint_date.description:
:MARC: ``269__c``
.. note::
    This is only for preprints. For the publication date of
    published documents, see :ref:`imprints`.
preprint_date.title: Preprint release date

artid.description:
:MARC: ``773__c`` (when it contains an ID instead of
    starting page or page range).
For journals which issue IDs for articles instead of
(or in complement to) continuous numbers within a
volume.
.. note::
    On legacy, this was treated as a starting page.
artid.title: Article ID

cnum.description:
The CNUM is based on the starting day of the conference, with an extra
number appended to distinguish conferences starting on the first day.
:example: The first conference (in order of creation on Inspire) starting
    on December 25, 1987 has CNUM ``C87-12-25`` whereas, say, the third
    one, has CNUM ``C87-12-25.2``
cnum.title: CNUM identifier of the conference

journal_title.description:
:MARC: ``773__p``
Journal title abbreviated as in the corresponding entry
in the Journals collection.
:example: ``Phys.Rev.``

material.description:
The possible values are:
``addendum``
    for a document extending the main publication.
``additional material``
    for additional material attached to the main publication, that is
    neither the more specific ``data`` or ``software``.
``data``
    for data related to the main publication.
``erratum``
    for a document correcting errors in the content of the main
    publication. When the errors are not in the content but in the
    publication process, it is considered as an ``editorial note`` instead.
``editorial note``
    for a document correcting errors in the metadata of the publication but
    not its content. Otherwise, it is an ``erratum``.
``preprint``
    for a document that is made public (typically on `arXiv
    <http://arxiv.org>`_) but not yet published formally.
``publication``
    for the main publication. If it's not published, it's a ``preprint``.
``reprint``
    for a reprint of the main publication.
``software``
    for software related to the main publication.
``translation``
    for a translation of the main publication.
material.title: Material to which the field refers

parent_isbn.description:
:MARC: ``773__z``
ISBN of the book of which this document is a part.

parent_report_number.description:
:MARC: ``773__r``
Report number of the document of which this record is a
part. This applies e.g. for large reports containing
several chapters that have been split into individual
records.

pubinfo_freetext.description:
:MARC: ``773__x``
Unstructured text describing the publication
information.
.. note::
    This field is used when provided with unstructured
    publication information, e.g. from arXiv. If known,
    the other fields should be used instead.

standard_numbers.description:
:MARC: ``021``
:example: ``BS-EN-485-1``
.. Note:: Used for Standards numbers only.

hidden.description: :MARC: True when the standard number is in ``021__b``

standard_numbers.title: List of standard numbers

subject_classification.description:
:MARC: ``084``, ``080``, ``050`` and ``082``
.. note: Subject classification of the document, following standards ; does not exist in Inspire

schema.description:
Describes to which schema the classification code belong
``UDC``
    :MARC: ``080``
    Universal Decimal Classification
``DEWEY``
    :MARC: ``082``
    Dewey
``ICS``
    :MARC: ``084``
    .. Note: 084 is also used for YR alphabetical ordering. *To be checked*
    Internation Classification of Standard
``LOC``
    :MARC: ``050``
    Library of Congress Classification
schema.title: Subject classification

source.description:
Source of the information in this field. As several records can be merged,
this information allows us to remember where every bit of metadata came
from and make decisions based on it.
:MARC: Often not present.
.. Notes::

subject_classification.title: List of keywords

thesis_info.description:
:MARC: ``502``
Information on a thesis (degree, date, university)

defense_date.description:
:MARC: ``500__a``
Date of the thesis defense. On legacy, this was put in the
note field as 'presented on ...'.

degree_type.description:
:MARC: ``502__b``
The `other` value means that the degree type is not known or is not among
the more specific values.
degree_type.title: Academic degree type

institutions.description:
:MARC: ``502__c``
List of institutions issuing the degree.

title: CDS Base Record Schema v1.0.0
